headline: In the Ukrainian Carpathians, peace feels both near and far
subhead: In Uzhhorod, a border city near Slovakia, exhausted and disillusioned residents have long stopped believing in victory and expect little from ongoing diplomatic talks. They only hope that the war will end, even 'if it means sacrificing a piece of the country to be saved.'

headline: US tariff threats over Greenland pose 'more political than economic' consequences for Europe
Affordability has become a dominant political issue in the US
Israeli hostages held in Gaza speak out about sexual violence while in captivity
subhead: Over the past two years, several people held captive by Hamas and other organizations have reported suffering sexual violence in addition to deprivation, beatings, humiliation and threats.

headline: Macron denounces US competition seeking to 'subordinate Europe'
subhead: In a speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, French President Emmanuel Macron also decried an 'endless accumulation of new tariffs that are fundamentally unacceptable.'

headline: Claude Le Roy: 'The Senegalese players were overwhelmed by emotion and completely lost control'
subhead: Claude Le Roy, the former coach of Senegal, Cameroon, Ghana and Togo discusses the confusion that marred the Africa Cup of Nations final between Morocco and Senegal and the governance of world football.

headline: Marine Duc, geographer: 'In Greenland, the memory of colonial violence remains strong'
subhead: Donald Trump's ambitions for the Arctic island have affected Danish policies toward the Inuit population and influenced the expression of Greenlandic nationalism, the academic explained in an interview with Le Monde.

New documentary offers rare look inside Macron's diplomatic team

JD Vance and wife Usha say they are expecting their fourth child

Denmark's far right is mired in contradictions over Greenland
Trump isolated after trade escalation with Europe over Greenland
subhead: The president's threats could undermine the agreement reached by the United States and the European Union in the summer of 2025.

headline: In one year, Trump has imposed a culture of impunity
subhead: Since returning to the White House, the American president has exempted himself from all rules, both domestically and internationally. This sense of impunity now permeates his entire administration.

headline: The strange airborne rescue of Gaza's donkeys, from Israel to Europe
subhead: Since 2022, Sharon Cohen, who runs an animal rescue group near Tel Aviv, has removed donkeys from Palestinian owners she accuses of mistreatment and sent them to shelters across Europe. The initiative has drawn outrage amid Gaza's deepening humanitarian crisis.

headline: France's Parliament must be protected from the fever of the presidential election
The necessary showdown with Donald Trump
